Interface Activity

  • All Superinterfaces:

    public interface Activity
extends com.guidewire.pl.domain.activity.gen.ActivityStubI
    ActivityBase An activity is a instance of work assigned to a user and belonging to a claim.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void approve()
      If the activity is open, marks the activity as approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.
      void assignToQueue(AssignableQueue queue)
      Assigns the activity to the specified queue, which must be non null.
      boolean autoAssign()
      Invokes the Assignment Engine, which will process the configured Assignment Rules to come up with an assignment for the current entity.
      boolean canApprove()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be approved.
      boolean canAssign()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be assigned.
      boolean canComplete()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be completed.
      boolean canEdit()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be edited.
      boolean canMakeMandatory()
      Indicates whether or not the current user can toggle the mandatory flag on this activity.
      boolean canRecur()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can generate a recurring activity.
      boolean canSkip()
      Returns true if the user can skip the activity based on the following: the activity is a GENERAL or APPROVAL_DENIED activity the activity is open the activity is assigned the activity is not mandatory the activity is not assigned to a queue the user has permission to modify the activity
      void complete()
      Completes an activity
      void defer()
      Deprecated. 
      use skip()
      com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query findViewableNotes()
      Find all nodes that are viewable by the current user
      java.lang.String getActivityStatus() 
      boolean isAssociatedWithDocumentTemplate() 
      boolean isAssociatedWithEmailTemplate() 
      boolean isOverdue()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the activity is overdue
      boolean isUpdatedSinceLastViewed()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this activity was updated since the last time it was viewed.
      Note newNote()
      Will create a new Note
      void reject()
      If the activity is open, marks the activity as not approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.
      void setActivityPattern(ActivityPattern pattern, java.util.Date targetDate, java.util.Date escalationDate)
      Sets the activity pattern with overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates.
      void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern)
      Sets the activity pattern and copy pattern's values into this activity,
      void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern, java.util.Date targetDate, java.util.Date escalationDate)
      Sets the activity pattern and copy the pattern's values into this activity.
      void setUp(Assignee assignee)
      Calls pre-setup rules, assigns the activity, then calls post-setup rules.
      void setUpAuto()
      Deprecated. 
      Please use autoAssign() or setUp(Assignee) (with gw.api.assignment.AutoAssignAssignee.INSTANCE as the argument) instead
      void skip()
      Sets an activity's state to skipped.

    • Method Detail

      • setActivityPattern

        void setActivityPattern(ActivityPattern pattern,
                      java.util.Date targetDate,
                      java.util.Date escalationDate)
        Sets the activity pattern with overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates. The target date and escalation date are used to override the starting point of target date and escalation date, respectively. The same date calculation still applies
        Parameters:
        pattern - The activity pattern used to populate the activity fields
        targetDate - The target date used to override the target starting point.
        escalationDate - The escalation date used to override the escalation starting point

      • setActivityPatternAndCopy

        void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern)
        Sets the activity pattern and copy pattern's values into this activity,
        Parameters:
        pattern - The activity pattern used to populate the activity fields

      • setActivityPatternAndCopy

        void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern,
                             java.util.Date targetDate,
                             java.util.Date escalationDate)
        Sets the activity pattern and copy the pattern's values into this activity. This overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates. The target date and escalation date are used to override the starting point of target date and escalation date, respectively. The same date calculation still applies
        Parameters:
        pattern - The activity pattern used to populate the activity fields
        targetDate - The target date used to override the target starting point.
        escalationDate - The escalation date used to override the escalation starting point

      • canEdit

        boolean canEdit()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be edited. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity is of status Open
        2. the user has the modify activity permission for this activity
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be edited

      • canApprove

        boolean canApprove()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be approved. Returns true if:
        1. the activity is of type Approval
        2. the activity is of status Open
        3. the activity is Assigned
        4. the activity is either assigned to the given user or the user has the "approveany" permission
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be approved

      • canSkip

        boolean canSkip()
        Returns true if the user can skip the activity based on the following:
        1. the activity is a GENERAL or APPROVAL_DENIED activity
        2. the activity is open
        3. the activity is assigned
        4. the activity is not mandatory
        5. the activity is not assigned to a queue
        6. the user has permission to modify the activity
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be skipped

      • canComplete

        boolean canComplete()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be completed. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity is of type General
        2. the activity is of status Open
        3. the activity is Assigned
        4. the activity is not assigned to a queue
        5. the user has the modify activity permission for this activity
            6. Note this test does not check anything particular to the activity and its requirements for completion.
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be completed

      • canRecur

        boolean canRecur()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can generate a recurring activity. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity's isRecurring property is non-null and equal to TRUE
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can recur

      • canAssign

        boolean canAssign()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be assigned. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity is of type Approval
        2. the activity is of status Open
        3. the activity is not assigned to a queue
        4. the user has the "assignactivity" permission
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be assigned

      • getActivityStatus

        java.lang.String getActivityStatus()
        Returns:
        activity status

      • autoAssign

        boolean autoAssign()
        Description copied from interface: Assignable
        Invokes the Assignment Engine, which will process the configured Assignment Rules to come up with an assignment for the current entity.

        May not be invoked from within an Assignment Rule, since the Assignment Engine may not be invoked recursively. If invoked from within an Assigment Rule, an error will be logged and false will be returned.

        Specified by:
        autoAssign in interface Assignable
        Returns:
        true if an assignment has been found, false otherwise

      • assignToQueue

        void assignToQueue(AssignableQueue queue)
                   throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException,
                          com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.IllegalAssignmentException
        Assigns the activity to the specified queue, which must be non null. If the engine cannot assign the item to the requested queue, it will throw an exception indicating the reason.
        Parameters:
        queue - The queue to which the item should be assigned - must be specified. If not known, use autoAssign(item) instead.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.IllegalAssignmentException

      • complete

        void complete()
              throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Completes an activity
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if the user does not have the permission

      • skip

        void skip()
          throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Sets an activity's state to skipped. If the activity is not open, does nothing at all.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - if activity is mandatory
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if the user does not have the permission

      • defer

        void defer()
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Deprecated. use skip()
        Synonym for skip(), retained for backwards compatibility
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if the user does not have permission

      • approve

        void approve()
             throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException,
                    com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException
        If the activity is open, marks the activity as approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.

        If the activity is not open, this is a no-op

        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if the user does not have permission
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException - workflow for activity is not valid

      • reject

        void reject()
            throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException,
                   com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException
        If the activity is open, marks the activity as not approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.

        If the activity is not open, this is a no-op

        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if the user does not have permission
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException - if the workflow for activity is not valid

      • findViewableNotes

        com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query findViewableNotes()
        Find all nodes that are viewable by the current user
        Returns:
        a query over Note

        Returns:

      • canMakeMandatory

        boolean canMakeMandatory()
        Indicates whether or not the current user can toggle the mandatory flag on this activity.
        Returns:
        true if the current user can toggle the mandatory flag on this activity, false otherwise

      • isUpdatedSinceLastViewed

        boolean isUpdatedSinceLastViewed()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this activity was updated since the last time it was viewed.
        Returns:
        true if activity has been updated since the last time it was viewed

      • isOverdue

        boolean isOverdue()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the activity is overdue
        Returns:
        true if over due

      • setUp

        void setUp(Assignee assignee)
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException
        Calls pre-setup rules, assigns the activity, then calls post-setup rules. This does not commit the activity to the database
        Parameters:
        assignee - the assignee to which the activity should be assigned
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException - if the assignment wasn't successful

      • setUpAuto

        void setUpAuto()
               throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException
        Deprecated. Please use autoAssign() or setUp(Assignee) (with gw.api.assignment.AutoAssignAssignee.INSTANCE as the argument) instead
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException - Cannot find assignment

        Returns:

        Returns:
